definition: to be very clear about sth (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid
distinct/clear/orderly/pain/suffering/deciduous bush used in Chinese medicine (genus Vitex)/punishment cane (old)
surname Chu/abbr. for Hubei 湖北省[Hu2 bei3 Sheng3] and Hunan 湖南省[Hu2 nan2 Sheng3] provinces together/Chinese kingdom during the Spring and Autumn and Warring States Periods (722-221 BC)

sentences.english: Spend time on being excruciatingly clear.
sentences.chinese: 花时间做到事事一清二楚。

sentences.english: If one flute goes out of tune – you’d know all about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果有一支长笛走掉了，你就会听的一清二楚。

sentences.english: These terms are clearly written in black and white. You can never deny them.
sentences.chinese: 这些条件白纸黑字，一清二楚，想抵赖是抵赖不掉的。

sentences.english: I’m on to your tricks and manipulations.
sentences.chinese: 我对你的诡计呵手段一清二楚。

sentences.english: B: Nope. They’re as clear as crystal.
I know if from A to Z.
The whole school knew every detail of this mad escapade.
sentences.chinese: 全校对这场疯狂的恶作剧的全部细节知道得一清二楚。

sentences.english: Five minutes of your time and this article will do just nicely.
sentences.chinese: 用五分钟读完这篇文章，你就可以一清二楚。

sentences.english: Too deeply too thick feelings, through kiss, let the whistling feeling get clear.
sentences.chinese: 太深太浓的感情，透过吻，让萧萧感受得一清二楚。

sentences.english: Speak clearly if you speak along with hasl. Carve every word prior to let it fhasl.
sentences.chinese: 要说就干脆说得一清二楚，说出前每句话要字斟句酌。

sentences.english: Don't play games with me, Jane. I'm on to your tricks and manipulations .
sentences.chinese: 简，别跟我搞鬼，我对你的诡计和手段一清二楚。

definition: to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
to be well aware
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
see 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
to know what's going on
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
unclear/not understood/currently unknown
without missing a word
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up
pretty close/very near/about right
to be confused/to be baffled
to prick up one's ears/to strain to hear sth
fearful/apprehensive
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
slight knowledge of sth/to know very little about a subject/a smattering
